label: What is the value?
What is the minimum value for the indicator that you can expect to find among the elements of the population?
What is the maximum value for the indicator that you can expect to find among the elements of the population?
Roughly what value for this proportion do you expect to find with this survey? If you have no idea whatsoever set it as 50%, otherwise provide your best estimate. Type your answer in the box
condition: type:value, controlName:q2.1.2, value:Proportion of elements in the population with the characteristics of the indicator

label: Who are you interested in? In other words, who or where should the data come from to be able to calculate the indicator of interest? We will refer to this as the final sampling units. Are they households? Or an individual person?  A community? This definition is important because the sampling is going to have to eventually reach them.

label: Are you interested in producing one estimate (a ‘headline value’) for each indicator for the whole population, or do you need to disaggregate the estimates? For example, they could be split up by geographical area or by camp, gender, age etc.

Is the list as complete and up-to-date as possible?
Notes for possibly outdated list
Are you planning to take a sample from the list or are you planning to use all units in this stage?

Are you planning to select the sampling units using

a. Simple Random Sampling, that is equal probability of selection for all the units.
b. Unequal probability of selection for different units, e.g. Probability Proportional to Size
